results.title: Come see the dolphins
results.creator_credit: Tom Ascher and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a young boy who accompanies his father, a dolphin keeper, to the zoo to see the dolphins. The boy learns of the appearance of dolphins, what they eat and how they communicate and navigate. Skillful photography includes observations underwater and behind the scenes views of equipment and workers needed to maintain the dolphin pool.

results.title: Come into my parlour, said the spider to the fly
results.creator_credit: Densey Clyne, Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the predatory techniques of the Australian spiders that feed on insects. Includes spiders that build lidded burrows, spin webs, stack their prey, cast nets, or lure moths into a whirling line.

results.title: Colonial Williamsburg
results.brief_description: Williamsburg - for 80 years the capital of England’s Virginia colony - has been restored to its former appearance and today is the only city in America that actually portrays it colonial heritage in its proper setting. Visitors may see how is actually was in the 17th century.

results.title: Colombo Plan and you
results.creator_credit: Department of Foreign Affairs and National Economic Council
results.brief_description: Tells something of the work being done by the Colombo Plan and of the assistance being given, by Australia amongst other nations, by means of the donation of machinery and the provision of technical advise. Focuses on the Philippines which is both a donor and a recipient of Colombo Plan and other forms of technical and economic assistance.

results.title: Colombian gold: the sweat of the sun
results.brief_description: Provides a history of Colombia. Catalogues the destruction carried out by the Spanish conquistadores, the influence of the Spanish and Catholic Church and the way of life of the various tribes. The gold artefacts and their production techniques are explained by Clemica Plazas de Nieto, curator of the Museo del Oro, Bogota.

results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of ‘journey making’ the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: Collection and preservation of evidence. Section I and II
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description: Instructional film portrays homicide investigation, including equipment necessary for the collection and preservation of evidence; examining details of collecting, marking, and preserving all evidence; photographic recording or sketching of the scene of the crime; evaluation of the evidence; questioning of suspects; and solution of the crime.
